result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Nathan Clausing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $518.00 due thru Extended Supervision within 6mos after release from prison in 12CF271.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin Nathan Clausing in court in custody with attorney Kristine A. Peshek.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   GUILTY plea.  PSI waived. 
180 days RCJail, cc w/12CF271 prison sentence.  94 days credit.  $518 costs due 6-11-15 or within 6mos after release from prison.
Status conference on April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Nathan Clausing in court in custody with attorney Kristine A. Peshek.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Remand to Branch 6 (to track with revocation in 12CF271).
Calendar call on March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Nathan Clausing in court in custody with attorney Kristine A. Peshek.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.   Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. No Guilty plea, Jury trial to be set. Bond Continued.
Preliminary hearing on February 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Benjamin Nathan Clausing not in court, defendant in custody.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds good cause to continue prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Benjamin Nathan Clausing in court in custody with attorney Kristine A. Peshek.  Lindsay Beth Healless appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Benjamin Nathan Clausing in court in custody by video conference with attorney Sean Drury.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. $500 Cash bond set,   No Intentional contact directly or indirectly with victim, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
No intentional contact directly or indirectly with victim, T.D., his residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
